channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Brian Phelan: Daniel Carroll found guilty of 2018 murder near Newry
item.description: The father-of-two died after being stabbed on a rural road near Newry in 2018.

item.title: Covid-19: Mother and daughter die days apart in hospital
item.description: Sammie-Jo Forde, 32. was treated two hospital beds away from her mother after both contracted the virus.

item.title: Irish president declines invite to NI centenary service
item.description: The event to mark Northern Ireland's centenary is being held in Armagh at the end of October.

item.title: DUP boycott could place £1bn in jeopardy, Conor Murphy claims
item.description: The party has said it would boycott most north-south meetings until the NI Protocol is changed.

item.title: EU Covid certs offer for Irish citizens in Northern Ireland
item.description: The Irish government is preparing to allow Irish passport holders to access EU "vaccine passports".

item.title: Teenager admits harassing BBC News NI journalist Aileen Moynagh
item.description: A 17-year-old from Dublin pleads guilty to harassing Belfast-based journalist Aileen Moynagh.

item.title: Ballymurphy families' shock over retention of body parts
item.description: They did not know tissue samples and organs were kept during the post-mortem examinations.

item.title: Simon Coveney: Irish foreign minister wins confidence vote
item.description: Ireland's foreign minister was under pressure over the appointment of a UN special envoy.

item.title: Racism high in unionist areas, Lilian Seenoi-Barr claims
item.description: The director of the North West Migrants Forum claimed racism was high in unionist areas.

item.title: Unmanned submarine earmarked for Irish Sea freight crossings
item.description: A start-up company has been given £380,000 to develop the hydrogen-powered concept.

item.title: Lyra McKee: Four men arrested in connection with journalist's death
item.description: The men, aged 19, 20, 21 and 33, were all detained on Wednesday under the Terrorism Act.

item.title: SDLP leader Colum Eastwood calls for new law to stop election if Stormont fails
item.description: SDLP leader Colum Eastwood says legislation is needed to halt an election if devolution collapses.

item.title: Ivermectin: Northern Ireland seizures of unproven horse drug used for Covid
item.description: More than 8,500 of the tablets have been seized coming into Northern Ireland since 2020.

item.title: Northern Ireland to Scotland bridge plans 'put to bed'
item.description: NI's infrastructure minister says she is pleased that the proposals have been shelved.

item.title: Covid-19: NI records 10 Covid-linked deaths,1,304 cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to coronavirus in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,478.

item.title: Covid-19: Close-contact pupils 'should not be sent home from school'
item.description: Officials say schools should not identify close contacts unless asked by the Public Health Agency.

item.title: Covid-19 vaccines for over-12s and boosters for over 50s
item.description: Northern Ireland's 12 to 15-year-olds will be offered one jab, while all over-50s and healthcare staff can get a third.

item.title: Covid-19: More than 10% of pupils not in school last week
item.description: Figures suggest about 10,000 pupils were at home due to self-isolation or social distancing.

item.title: Northern Ireland nurses 'showing signs of inability to keep going'
item.description: The Royal College of Nursing calls for urgent action with hospitals under pressure.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: All children aged 12-15 across the UK will be offered one dose of the Pifzer vaccine.

item.title: What are Northern Ireland's Covid-19 rules now?
item.description: How do restrictions here compare to other parts of the UK and the Republic of Ireland?

item.title: Miss Ireland 2021: First black winner 'proud' of crown
item.description: Pamela Uba moved to the country as a seven-year-old - now she's making history after taking the title.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Q&A: The Simon Coveney appointment row
item.description: Ireland's foreign affairs minister won a confidence motion over the appointment of a UN special envoy.

item.title: Family of boy with disabilities 'drained' by lack of respite service
item.description: A health trust breached its legal duty to a severely disabled child amid the pandemic, says a judge.

item.title: NI 100: Parliament's temporary home in a Belfast college
item.description: It is 100 years since the Union Theological College was co-opted to be the centre of political power.

item.title: Northern Ireland landscape: Searching for the perfect picture
item.description: BBC News NI speaks to people spending their spare time looking for sunrises, storm clouds and stars.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Concerts won't happen if distancing isn't removed'
item.description: Concert promoters say restrictions at indoor gigs mean big acts are pulling out of Northern Ireland.

item.title: Mum's frustration over baby's surgery cancellation
item.description: A mother voices her frustration at the repeated cancellation of her baby's cleft palate surgery.

item.title: Covid-19: Vaccines for 12 to 15-year-olds 'could start in October'
item.description: The head of NI's vaccination programme believes those aged 12 to 15 will be offered jabs in October.

item.title: High Street voucher scheme 'an adrenaline shot for businesses'
item.description: High street vouchers aimed at boosting Northern Ireland businesses will be issued from next month.

item.title: Londonderry: Man dies in Clooney Terrace house fire
item.description: Police are conducting enquiries but say at this stage the death is not being treated as suspicious.

item.title: All-Ireland final: Tyrone players given heroes' welcome
item.description: Thousands of fans cheer on the All-Ireland champions at their home ground of Healy Park in Omagh.

item.title: Dungiven: Viable pipe bomb found during security alert
item.description: It was a "completely reckless" act to leave a device in a residential area, police say.

item.title: Driver killed in single-car crash in County Tyrone
item.description: Darren Canavan, 31, was pronounced dead at the scene on the Kilmascally Road in Ardboe.

item.title: TikTok faces privacy investigations by EU watchdog
item.description: The Irish regulator says it is looking at how TikTok handles children's data - and where it goes.

item.title: Kerry Babies: Remains exhumed in 1984 baby death investigation
item.description: A baby boy at the centre of an infamous Irish scandal has never been identified.

item.title: Nancy Stewart: One of Ireland's oldest women dies aged 107
item.description: Nancy Stewart from Clonard in County Meath died on Friday morning at her family home.

item.title: Donegal mica: Crumbling house homeowners protest
item.description: Protesters want the Irish government to revamp a support scheme which they say is not fit for purpose.

item.title: Covid-19: 90% of adults in Republic of Ireland now fully vaccinated
item.description: The vaccine rollout is to continue across the country, with children 12 and over able to receive a jab.
